common.signInRequired: Please sign in to use Kizuna AI as your provider

settings.title: Settings
settings.fetchingApiKey: Fetching API key from your account...
settings.apiKeyInfo: Your API key is stored locally and never sent to any server except to the API provider.
settings.regionNotSupported: Service not available in your region. Please check your network environment or try a different provider.
settings.sessionActiveNotice: Settings are locked while session is active. Please end the session to modify settings.
settings.experimentalFeatureTooltip: This is an experimental feature and may be unstable.
settings.volcengineInfoText: Volcengine Real-time Speech Translation provides text-only translation output. Audio synthesis is not supported in this mode.
settings.geminiParticipantTokenWarning: Gemini participant mode generates audio responses that are discarded, resulting in additional token usage.
settings.kizunaApiKeyInfo: This API key is automatically managed by our backend service.
settings.providerTooltip: Choose your AI translation service. Each service has different features, voices, and pricing. OpenAI offers the most features, while Gemini provides a good free tier.
settings.apiKeyTooltip: Your API key is like a password for the AI service. Get it from the provider's website and keep it safe. Never share it with others.
settings.clientIdTooltip: Your PalabraAI account ID. This identifies your account. Get it from your PalabraAI dashboard.
settings.clientSecretTooltip: Your PalabraAI secret key. Keep this private and secure. Never share it with anyone.
settings.uiLanguageTooltip: Changes the language of Sokuji's menus and buttons. This does NOT affect which languages you can translate between.
settings.modelTooltip: The AI model affects speed and quality. 'Mini' models are faster but simpler. Standard models are more accurate but slightly slower. Try mini first for cost efficiency.
settings.voiceTooltip: Choose the AI's speaking voice. Each voice has different tone and style. Try different ones to find your favorite.
settings.sourceLanguageTooltip: The language you speak. The AI will listen for this language and translate it.
settings.targetLanguageTooltip: The language to translate into. The AI will speak your words in this language.
settings.turnDetectionTooltip:
How AI knows when you've finished speaking. 
Normal: Waits for silence. 
Semantic: AI understands context. 
Disabled: Manual control.
settings.thresholdTooltip: Voice detection sensitivity (0.0-1.0). Lower values detect quieter sounds but may trigger accidentally. Higher values need louder speech. Default 0.5 works for most.
settings.prefixPaddingTooltip: Silent time to keep before your speech starts (seconds). Helps capture the beginning of sentences. Too high delays response. Try 0.3-0.5.
settings.silenceDurationTooltip: How long to wait after you stop talking (seconds). Short = quick response but might cut you off. Long = waits patiently but slower. Try 0.5.
settings.semanticEagernessTooltip:
How quickly AI decides you're done (Semantic mode only). 
Auto: AI decides. 
Low: Very patient. 
Medium: Balanced. 
High: Quick to respond.
settings.temperatureTooltip: Translation creativity (0.0-1.0). Lower = more literal, word-for-word translation. Higher = more natural, conversational style. For translation, 0.7-0.9 works best.
settings.maxTokensTooltip: Maximum length of each translation. Tokens are like word pieces - 100 tokens ≈ 75 words. 2048-4096 good for conversations. 'inf' = unlimited.
settings.transcriptModelTooltip:
Speech recognition model. 
whisper-1: Standard, reliable. 
gpt-4o-mini: Faster, good for common languages. 
gpt-4o: Most accurate for accents/technical terms.
settings.noiseReductionTooltip:
Background noise removal. 
None: No processing, use in quiet rooms. 
Near field: For headsets/close microphones. 
Far field: For speakers/conference rooms with echo.
settings.systemInstructionsTooltip: Custom instructions for the AI translator. Tell it your preferences like formal/casual tone, technical terms handling, or specific translation style.
settings.transportTypeTooltip:
WebRTC: Lower latency, recommended for most users.
WebSocket: Better compatibility with restrictive networks. Use if WebRTC connection fails.
settings.webrtcVadDisabledTitle: Server VAD is not available in WebRTC mode
settings.webrtcVadNotice: Server VAD is disabled in WebRTC mode. In WebRTC, the server automatically truncates audio when it detects speech, which interrupts translations.
settings.participantInstructionsTooltip:
System instructions for translating participant audio. If empty, the main instructions above will be used.

Important: Your main instructions may have the wrong language direction for participants. Example: If you speak Chinese and your main instructions translate Chinese→Japanese, but participants speak Japanese, the main instructions would incorrectly try to translate Japanese→Japanese. Set separate participant instructions to translate Japanese→Chinese.

simpleSettings.fetchingApiKey: Fetching API key from your account...
simpleSettings.quickSetupDesc: Choose a preset for common scenarios
simpleSettings.howToGetApiKey: How to get an API key?
simpleSettings.apiKeyHelp2: 2. Sign up or log in to your account
simpleSettings.apiKeyHelp4: 4. Create a new API key and copy it here
simpleSettings.apiKeyHelpTooltip: An API key is like a password that lets Sokuji use AI translation services. You need to get one from your chosen provider (like OpenAI).
simpleSettings.audioSettingsDesc: Configure your microphone and speakers in the Audio panel
simpleSettings.kizunaApiKeyInfo: This API key is automatically managed by our backend service.

audioPanel.title: Audio Settings
audioPanel.virtualMicWarningTitle: This is a virtual microphone created by Sokuji.
audioPanel.virtualMicWarningText1: Please do not select this device here. Instead, use this virtual microphone in your video conferencing applications (like Google Meet, Zoom, Microsoft Teams, etc.) to receive the live speech translation output.
audioPanel.virtualMicWarningText2: For Sokuji to work properly, please select your actual physical microphone from the list.
audioPanel.virtualSpeakerWarningTitle: This is a virtual speaker created by Sokuji.
audioPanel.virtualSpeakerWarningText1: Please do not select this device as your monitor. The Sokuji_Virtual_Speaker is used by Sokuji to output audio to your conferencing applications.
audioPanel.virtualSpeakerWarningText2: Connecting your monitor to Sokuji's output device would create an audio feedback loop, causing your input to contain your own monitored output.
audioPanel.virtualSpeakerWarningText3: The "Turn On" switch connects the virtual speaker to your selected monitor device, allowing you to hear what's being sent to your conferencing application. The "Turn Off" switch disconnects this monitoring connection.
audioPanel.virtualSpeakerWarningText4: For proper operation, please select a different monitor device (like your headphones or speakers) from the list.
audioPanel.realVoicePassthroughDescription: Pass your original audio (speaker's voice) directly to the virtual microphone so listeners can hear both original and translated audio
audioPanel.mutualExclusivitySpeakerText: Please turn off Participant Audio before enabling Speaker.
audioPanel.mutualExclusivityParticipantText: Please turn off Speaker before enabling Participant Audio.
audioPanel.screenRecordingDeniedText1: Participant Audio requires Screen Recording permission to capture system audio.
audioPanel.screenRecordingDeniedText2: Please go to System Preferences > Privacy & Security > Screen Recording and enable Sokuji.
audioPanel.screenRecordingDeniedText3: After enabling the permission, please restart the app.

auth.signInToUseKizunaAI: Please sign in to use Kizuna AI service
auth.kizunaaiNotAvailable: Kizuna AI is only available when signed in
auth.name: Name
auth.userNotFound: No account found with this email

simpleConfig.interfaceLanguageDesc: This changes the language of Sokuji's menus and buttons. It does NOT affect which languages you can translate between.
simpleConfig.translationLanguagesDesc: Choose which language you speak (Your Language) and which language you want to hear the translation in (Target Language). Select "Auto Detect" if you're unsure about the source language.
simpleConfig.userAccountTooltip: For users with technical knowledge and their own API keys, you can use your own API key whether logged in or not. User Account is designed for new users who prefer a simplified setup without complex configuration.
simpleConfig.signInDescription: Sign up for a convenient experience without complex configuration.
simpleConfig.signInRequired: You can use your own AI provider and API key without logging in, or sign up to purchase and use kizuna.ai's API service.
simpleConfig.microphoneDesc: Select the microphone to capture your speech. Speak your language into this microphone, and Sokuji will translate everything it hears in real-time.
simpleConfig.speaker: Speaker
simpleConfig.speakerDesc: Select a speaker for monitoring the translated output. This lets you hear how the translation sounds. You can turn it off if monitoring is not needed. Whether on or off, the translated audio is always sent to the virtual microphone for other participants to hear.
simpleConfig.systemAudioDesc: Capture and translate audio from other meeting participants. Select which audio output device to capture for translating their speech.
simpleConfig.systemAudioDescExtension: Capture and transcribe audio from the current tab. Select an output device to hear the meeting audio while transcribing.

openaiCompatible.customEndpointHelp: Enter your custom OpenAI-compatible API endpoint URL

mainPanel.apiKeyRequired: Please add a valid OpenAI API Key in settings first
mainPanel.modelsRequired: Models are required. Please validate your API key first to load available models.

audioFeedback.speakerModeDescription: Speaker mode active - high risk of echo affecting translation quality.

userTypeSelection.title: Welcome to Sokuji
userTypeSelection.subtitle: Please select your user type to get started

regular.title: Regular User
regular.description: I'm new to AI services or prefer a simple experience

experienced.title: Experienced User
experienced.description: I have my own API keys and understand AI services
experienced.feature1: Have OpenAI or Gemini API keys

welcome.title: Welcome to Sokuji
welcome.content: Welcome to Sokuji! This simple guide will help you start using real-time translation in just a few steps.

settings.title: Step 1: Open Settings
settings.content: Click here to open Settings where you can configure your languages and audio devices.

uiModeToggle.title: Step 2: UI Mode Toggle
uiModeToggle.content: You can switch between Basic and Advanced modes anytime using this button. Basic mode shows simplified options, while Advanced mode provides full control.

account.title: Step 3: User Account
account.content: Sign in for a simple experience, or use your own API key without logging in. New users can sign up for kizuna.ai's API service.

languages.title: Step 4: Choose Languages
languages.content: Select your source language (what you speak) and target language (what you want to hear).

microphone.title: Step 5: Select Microphone
microphone.content: Select your microphone from the list. This is what will capture your voice.

speaker.title: Step 6: Select Speaker
speaker.content: Choose your speakers or headphones to hear the translation. Headphones are recommended.

start.title: Step 7: Start Translating
start.content: Click 'Start' to begin translating! Just speak naturally and hear the translation in real-time.

complete.title: All Set!
complete.content: Perfect! You're ready to use Sokuji. Click Start and begin speaking to hear real-time translations.

welcome.title: Welcome to Sokuji
welcome.content: Welcome to Sokuji! This guide will help you set up the extension for live speech translation. Let's get started!

settings.title: Step 1: Open Settings
settings.content: First, let's configure your settings. Click here to open the Settings panel where you can set up your OpenAI API key and customize system instructions.

apiKey.title: Step 2: Configure API Key
apiKey.content: Enter your OpenAI API key here. You can get one from the
apiKey.required: This is required for the speech translation to work.

systemInstructions.title: Step 3: System Instructions
systemInstructions.content: Customize the system instructions to control how the AI responds. You can modify the translation behavior and add specific requirements here.

voiceSettings.title: Step 4: Voice Settings
voiceSettings.content: Configure the voice type that will be used for speech synthesis. Choose from different voice options to match your preference.

turnDetection.title: Step 5: Turn Detection
turnDetection.content: Configure automatic turn detection settings including detection mode, threshold, and audio parameters for optimal speech recognition performance.

audioSettings.title: Step 6: Audio Settings
audioSettings.content: Next, let's configure your audio settings. Click here to open the Audio panel and set up your microphone and speakers.

microphoneSetup.title: Step 7: Microphone Setup
microphoneSetup.content: Select your microphone device here. Make sure to choose the correct input device for the best audio quality.

speakerSetup.title: Step 8: Speaker Setup
speakerSetup.content: Select a monitoring device to listen to the translated audio and verify if it meets your requirements. It is recommended to use headphones for monitoring to avoid interference with microphone input. When you are satisfied with the translation settings, it is suggested to turn off monitoring so you can focus more on your expression without microphone interference.

startSession.title: Step 9: Start Session
startSession.content: Click the "Start Session" button to begin using Sokuji. Once started, you can speak naturally for live translation. If Automatic turn detection is disabled, use "Push to Talk" (Space key) to speak.

complete.title: Setup Guide Complete!
complete.content: Great! You've completed the setup guide and are now familiar with the interface. To start using Sokuji, please enter your OpenAI API key in the settings, grant microphone permissions when prompted, and select "Sokuji Virtual Microphone" as your microphone in your meeting application (Google Meet, Zoom, Microsoft Teams, etc.). You can restart this guide anytime from the settings.

logs.webrtcFallback: WebRTC connection failed, using WebSocket instead

feedback.title: Send Feedback
feedback.description: Report bugs, suggest features, or share your thoughts. We read every message!
feedback.success: Thank you! Your feedback has been sent successfully.
feedback.error: Failed to send feedback. Please try again.
feedback.signInRequiredDesc: Please sign in to submit feedback. We need your account to respond to your feedback.
feedback.verificationRequiredDesc: Please verify your email address before submitting feedback. We need a verified email to respond to your feedback.
feedback.remainingCount: You have {{remaining}} of {{limit}} feedback messages remaining today
feedback.limitReached: Daily limit reached. You can send more feedback tomorrow.
